titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the James M. Blanks and Company Account Book 1854-1855
titlestmt.subtitle: Banks, James M., and Company, Account Bo Mss. Acc. 2004.33

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Anne T. Johnson, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the James M. Blanks and Company Account Book, 1854-1855 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2004.33
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2009 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: James M. Blanks and Company Account Book 1854-1855
did.abstract: Account book of James M. Blanks and Company of Clarkesville, Mecklenburg County, Virginia. Account Book cover is in fragile condition and the ink in the interior is faded due to water damage.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James M. Blanks and Company Account Book, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center from Carman D. Valentino on 06/14/2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James M. Blanks owned James M. Blanks and Company store in Mecklenburg County, Virginia during at least 1854-1855. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of James M. Blanks and Company of Clarkesville, Mecklenburg County, Virginia. Account Book cover is in fragile condition and the ink in the interior is faded due to water damage.
James M. Blanks sold textbooks and a list of these textbooks has been placed with the account book along with a list of some of the other items sold.
R.A. Puryear as administrator for Alex Gillis
(William?) H. Thomson (principal of High Fall Academy)
John T. Carter, guardian for Wash. Watkins

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p: Accounts are in date order, with names of clients on each page.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
